item.title: Clearing of Street gutters, 9th June
item.description:
This morning starting at 6.55am we were awoken to two men scrapping debris from the gutters and using a very loud blower to dislodge this. The time and noise in itself was not a problem, we are pleased to see street maintenance being undertaken, however the job was started so early in the morning that few if any cars had left for work and the job could not be done properly. There is a parking restriction between 10 and 12am when no cars are present. A later time for this job would have produced a more thorough and cost effective job which will not need to be repeated so soon.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Rydal Drive, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Woods not managed, 9th June
item.description:
Church House Gardens woods are being neglected. No obvious signs of woodland management. Specimen trees are at risk. The Park is becoming an icon for Bromley Council's lack of environmental management despite a £100k appointment.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marina Close, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead Duck Pond, 9th June
item.description:
Negligent by Bromley Council. This pond is dead. Empty, and getting refilled only with litter (it was cleared by volunteers at the beginning of March to improve the pond for the breeding season. Now like at it. Bromley Council this is a disgrace. The Friends of Bromley Town parks would like to help. Support us! BUT this is your responsibility.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tetty Way, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Left on the Warren, 9th June
item.description:
Good morning, I came across this motorcycle this morning, as you can see it’s been parked on the lower field of the Warren. Possibly stolen, you might want to liaise with the Met Police. Please arrange removal before the local kids start playing with it. It’s probably missed by its owner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broomfield Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raw chicken left in the street, 9th June
item.description:
Someone keeps leaving carrier bags full of raw chicken on the eastern side of York Grove, and also on the corner with Coll’s Rd. This photo is from one of four incidents in the last three weeks. This is dangerous to dogs in the area, for people and also attracts vermin.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): York Grove, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
